snippet: Brooklyn groups offered praise, but the city and the Environmental Protection Agency are arguing over who should pay to fix the sewers into the canal.
abstract: Environmental Protection Agency announces seven proposals to clean up the polluted Gowanus Canal, which has been designated a federal Superfund site; efforts will cost $351 million to $456 million according to the agency; New York City Environmental Protection Dept officials express some reservations over the plan, disputing in particular the EPA’s claim that the city is responsible for paying to fix the sewage systems that feed into the canal.
lead_paragraph: Brooklyn groups offered praise, but the city and the Environmental Protection Agency are arguing over who should pay to fix the sewers into the canal.

headline.seo: E.P.A. Announces Proposals to Clean Gowanus Canal
headline.main: U.S. Announces Proposals to Clean Gowanus Canal
headline.print_headline: U.S. Announces Proposals To Clean Gowanus Canal
